meanings.definition: (adjective) tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness
meanings.sent1: The clown wore a flamboyant costume with bright colors and large polka dots.
meanings.sent2: Her flamboyant personality always made her the center of attention at parties.
meanings.sent3: The flamboyant peacock strutted around the garden, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in a flamboyant display of oranges, pinks, and purples.
meanings.sent5: The flamboyant decorations at the carnival created a festive and lively atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The actor was known in Hollywood as a flamboyant for his extravagant outfits.
meanings.sent2: She was considered a flamboyant in the fashion industry due to her bold and daring designs.
meanings.sent3: The flamboyant at the party stole the show with their energetic dance moves.
meanings.sent4: The artist was a true flamboyant, always expressing themselves boldly through their work.
meanings.sent5: The flamboyant's presence at the event added a touch of glamour and excitement.
